meanings.definition: A person who has been erased from existence or memory, typically by a totalitarian government.
meanings.sent1: The unperson was once a prominent figure in society, but now no one remembers them.
meanings.sent2: The government declared him an unperson, and all records of his existence were destroyed.
meanings.sent3: At the party, they joked that if you forget your friend's birthday, you'll become an unperson.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the villain had the power to turn people into unpersons with a single command.
meanings.sent5: The concept of an unperson is both eerie and thought-provoking.

meanings.definition: To remove someone from official records or recognition.
meanings.sent1: The dictator tried to unperson anyone who opposed his rule.
meanings.sent2: She feared that her former employer would unperson her after she left the company.
meanings.sent3: The teacher playfully threatened to unperson any student who didn't turn in their homework.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to unperson all employees who leaked confidential information.
meanings.sent5: The decision to unperson individuals from history is a chilling act of control.
